name: Blonanserin
summary: An atypical antipsychotic used primarily in East Asia for the treatment of schizophrenia, with dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A antagonism.
description: Blonanserin is an atypical (second-generation) antipsychotic approved in Japan, South Korea, and China for the treatment of schizophrenia. It has a high affinity for dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, with relatively lower affinity for histamine H1 and muscarinic receptors, which may result in a lower risk of sedation and anticholinergic effects compared to some other atypicals. Limited evidence suggests it may also be effective for bipolar disorder and other psychotic conditions, but its use is largely region-specific.

contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to blonanserin or excipients

sections.text: Blonanserin blocks dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2A receptors, modulating neurotransmission in pathways implicated in psychosis.

adult.titrate: Increase gradually based on response and tolerability

sections.geriatric: Use lower starting doses and monitor closely
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; no formal dose adjustment established

sections.text: Antipsychotic effects may be observed within 1–2 weeks, with full effect over several weeks.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: May cause extrapyramidal symptoms at higher doses
Monitor for metabolic changes, though risk is lower than with some other atypicals

sections.pregnancy: Use if benefits outweigh risks; limited human data
sections.geriatrics: Higher sensitivity to adverse effects; lower initial doses recommended

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over weeks to months to avoid withdrawal dyskinesia or symptom relapse.

items: Less sedating and less likely to cause weight gain than olanzapine or quetiapine
Primarily marketed in East Asia; not FDA-approved in the U.S.

seo.title: Blonanserin (Lonasen): Dosing, Side Effects, Clinical Use
seo.description: Detailed guide to blonanserin, an atypical antipsychotic used in East Asia for schizophrenia, with dosing, adverse effects, and clinical notes.
